frame.name: Leaving_traces
frame.definition:
<def-root>A piece of <fen>Evidence</fen> indicates that an <fen>Event</fen> occured, or metonymically, <fen>Entity</fen> had formerly existed, in a <fen>Location</fen>. The <fen>Evidence</fen> consists of physical changes to the <fen>Location</fen> that resulted from the <fen>Event</fen>. Some LUs of this frame are general (trace.n) while others specifically involve evidence of motion (trail.n, track.n, wake.n, contrail.n) or existence (vestige.n).
<ex>He was careful to make sure that there was no <fex name="Evidence"><t>trace</t></fex> <fex name="Event">of tampering</fex> <fex name="Location">in the file</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">The fugitives</fex> left <fex name="Evidence"><t>tracks</t></fex> <fex name="Location">in their wake</fex> leading the authorities to their hiding spot.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition:
<def-root>The thing that indicates an Entity was in a Location.
He found traces of the burglar in the hallway.</def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The thing whose former existence in a Location can be deduced from the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
Traces of the former inhabitants can still be found in the abandoned manor.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element describes characteristics and properties of the <fen>Evidence</fen> not covered by other frame elements.</def-root>

FE.name: Location
FE.definition: <def-root>The place or context in which the <fex name="">Evidence</fex> of an is discovered, showing that an <fex name="">Event</fex> occured there or an <fex name="">Entity</fex> existed there.</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>An event whose details are revealed through the discovery of <fen>Evidence</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of the time that an <fen>Event</fen> occurs or an <fen>Entity</fen> exists at a place.</def-root>

FE.name: Reliability
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of how clearly the <fen>Evidence</fen> indicates the former <fen>Event</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: trace.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an indication that something happened

lexUnit.name: track.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: mark left by the paw, foot, shoe, tire, or other locomotive appendage or apparatus that results from passage of some creature or vehicle moving through a location.

lexUnit.name: trail.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: collection of changes along an inferred continuous line that indicate the path taken by a moving entity.

lexUnit.name: wake.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the noticeable disruption of water that results from the passage of watercraft or (rarely) water animals and remains for some time after the passage.

lexUnit.name: contrail.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the visible particles in air left behind by passing jet engines and rockets.

lexUnit.name: vestige.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a detectable indication that some entity had been present (at some location).
